lines: You are in a sandbox playing with your favorite toy. An older girl pulls it away from you and screams, "MINE!"
The child seems much stronger than you. She puts three fingers in your mouth and tries to push you away. She is holding the toy above your head.
"AAaaaaaaAAAaaaOW," the other girl yells. You bit her hard. She drops your toy and runs off.

CRASH! The toy comes down right on your head. CRASH! Again! CRASH! Again! You are beginning to feel dizzy. You cry out. CRASH! CRASH! She finally stops, but your head and face are covered with scratches.

The girl's mother takes her away before either one of your parents can tell what happened. She is a problem child, because she hits other children. She has done this before. You were treated unfairly.
She was much bigger than you. You might have gotten hurt. From a safe distance you watch her put your toy down and go play someplace else. Do you want to go back for your toy?
You retrieve your toy with no difficulty. You showed good judgment in this situation.
The girl comes back and reclaims your toy. Are you going to fight for it?
You grab for the toy and are scratched by the girl. Your arm starts to bleed, but you pull hard and run to your mother for safety.
You have given up your toy. This whole experience has been very unfair.
Fortunately, your mother becomes aware of what has happened and gets your toy back for you.
You are able to get your toy back. The girl gets a spanking from her mother.
No adult can understand what you're trying to say. You get put back in the sandbox, where the other girl throws sand in your face.
Your crying excites the girl who has been bothering you. She picks up a bucket of sand and dumps it out on your face. It gets into your mouth and eyes.
The girl backs off, and you get your toy back.
The girl is much stronger than you. She scratches you in the eye and runs away. You were treated unfairly.
Because you are nervous, your action is weak and tentative. The girl puts three fingers in your mouth and tries to push you away from her newly claimed toy.
You begin to get up and run for an adult, but the girl grabs you and pulls you down.
You knock the wind out of her and run away. Your mother gets your toy back for you.

You miss her. The girl scratches you and pulls your hair. She makes your face and arms bleed. Her mother sees her and doesn't even spank her. She is the lenient type who doesn't believe in punishment.
You send out loud cries of anxious protest. The girl sees you and brings your toy back. You reach for it.

SMACK! She slaps you right in the face and laughs. Her mother sees her and pulls her away. Your mother sees her mother and gives her a piece of her mind. It is wasted. This woman doesn't really care about the behavior of her child.
This girl actually has some kindness in her. She gives you your toy back and "makes nice" by rubbing your hair. She becomes your friend.
